TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi beforefieldinit Control/ControlCollection extends System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Collections.IList, class System.ICloneable

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Remove%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.RemoveAt%2A> methods enable you to add and remove individual controls from the collection. You can also use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.AddRange%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Clear%2A> methods to add or remove all the controls from the collection.
You can determine if a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> is a member of the collection by passing the control into the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Contains%2A> method. To get the index value of the location of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> in the collection, pass the control into the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.IndexOf%2A> method. The collection can be copied into an array by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection.CopyTo%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example removes a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> of the derived class <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> if it is a member of the collection. The example requires that you have created a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel>, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button>, and at least one <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> control on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> controls are added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> control, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> control added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>. When the button is clicked, the radio button named `radioButton2` is removed from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection>.
[!code-cpp[ControlCollection#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/CPP/controlcollection.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp[ControlCollection#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/CS/controlcollection.cs#4)] [!code-vb[ControlCollection#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/VB/controlcollection.vb#4)]

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Add (System.Windows.Forms.Control value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Add(class System.Windows.Forms.Control value) cil managed

Docs.param: The to add to the control collection.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified control to the control collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Add%2A> method allows you to add <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> objects to the end of the control collection.
You can also add new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> objects to the collection by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
To remove a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> that you previously added, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Remove%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.RemoveAt%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Clear%2A> methods.
> [!NOTE] > A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> can only be assigned to one <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> at a time. If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> is already a child of another control it is removed from that control before it is added to another control.
## Examples The following code example adds a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> of the derived class <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel>. The example requires that you have created a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> control and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> control on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>. When the button is clicked, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control is added to the panel's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection>.
[!code-cpp[ControlCollection#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/CPP/controlcollection.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[ControlCollection#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/CS/controlcollection.cs#2)] [!code-vb[ControlCollection#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/VB/controlcollection.vb#2)]

Docs.exception: The specified control is a top-level control, or a circular control reference would result if this control were added to the control collection.
The object assigned to the parameter is not a .

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's method to ensure that the control is added to the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void AddRange (System.Windows.Forms.Control[] controls);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddRange(class System.Windows.Forms.Control[] controls) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of objects to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds an array of control objects to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> objects contained in the `controls` array are appended to the end of the collection.
You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.AddRange%2A> method to quickly add a group of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> objects to the collection instead of manually adding each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> to the collection using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Add%2A> method.
To remove a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> that you previously added, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Remove%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.RemoveAt%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Clear%2A> methods.
## Examples The following code example adds two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> objects to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> of the derived class <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel>. The example requires that you have created a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> control and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> control on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>. When the button is clicked, two <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> controls are added to the panel's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection>.
[!code-cpp[ControlCollection#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/CPP/controlcollection.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[ControlCollection#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/CS/controlcollection.cs#3)] [!code-vb[ControlCollection#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/VB/controlcollection.vb#3)]

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's method to ensure that the controls are added to the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Clear ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all controls from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Clear%2A> method to remove the entire collection of controls from a parent control.
To remove an individual control from the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Remove%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.RemoveAt%2A> methods.
> [!IMPORTANT] > Calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Clear%2A> method does not remove control handles from memory. You must explicitly call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Dispose%2A> method to avoid memory leaks.
To add new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> objects to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Add%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.AddRange%2A> methods.
## Examples The following code example removes all the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> objects in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> of the derived class <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel>. The example requires that you have created a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel>, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button>, and at least one other control on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>. The other controls are added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> control, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>. When the button is clicked, all the controls contained in the panel are removed from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection>.
[!code-cpp[ControlCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/CPP/controlcollection.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[ControlCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/CS/controlcollection.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ControlCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/VB/controlcollection.vb#1)]

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's method to ensure that all the controls are removed from the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Contains (System.Windows.Forms.Control control);
.method public hidebysig instance bool Contains(class System.Windows.Forms.Control control) cil managed

Docs.param: The to locate in the collection.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the specified control is a member of the collection.
Docs.returns: if the is a member of the collection; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method enables you to determine whether a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> is a member of the collection before attempting to perform operations on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control>. You can use this method to confirm that a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> has been added to or is still a member of the collection.
## Examples The following code example removes a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> of the derived class <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> if it is a member of the collection. The example requires that you have created a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel>, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button>, and at least one <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> control on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> controls are added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> control, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> control added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>. When the button is clicked, the radio button named `removeButton` is removed from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection>.
[!code-cpp[ControlCollection#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/CPP/controlcollection.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp[ControlCollection#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/CS/controlcollection.cs#4)] [!code-vb[ControlCollection#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/VB/controlcollection.vb#4)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the control is not found in the collection, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.IndexOf%2A> method return value is -1.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int IndexOfKey (string key);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 IndexOfKey(string key) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the control to search for.
Docs.summary: Retrieves the index of the first occurrence of the specified item within the collection.
Docs.returns: The zero-based index of the first occurrence of the control with the specified name in the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> is called successively, the last returned index will be checked for a key match first, and if there is no match, the search starts at the beginning of the collection.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive. If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, or an item with the specified key is not found, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> returns -1.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Name%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection>.

.property instance class System.Windows.Forms.Control Item(int32)

Docs.value: The located at the specified index location within the control collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To retrieve a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection>, reference the collection object with a specific index value. The index value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> is a zero-based index.

Docs.exception: The value is less than zero or is greater than or equal to the number of controls in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Remove (System.Windows.Forms.Control value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Remove(class System.Windows.Forms.Control value) cil managed

Docs.param: The to remove from the .
Docs.summary: Removes the specified control from the control collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> is removed from the control collection, all subsequent controls are moved up one position in the collection.
You can also remove a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method, or remove all controls by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Clear%2A> method.
To add new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> objects to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Add%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.AddRange%2A> methods.
## Examples The following code example removes a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> of the derived class <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> if it is a member of the collection. The example requires that you have created a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel>, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button>, and one or more <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> controls on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RadioButton> controls are added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> control, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> control is added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>. When the button is clicked, the radio button named `radioButton2` is removed from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection>.
[!code-cpp[ControlCollection#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/CPP/controlcollection.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp[ControlCollection#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/CS/controlcollection.cs#4)] [!code-vb[ControlCollection#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/VB/controlcollection.vb#4)]

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's method to ensure that the control is removed from the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RemoveAt (int index);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RemoveAt(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The index value of the to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes a control from the control collection at the specified indexed location.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> is removed from the control collection, all subsequent controls are moved up one position in the collection.
You can also remove a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> that you previously added by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Remove%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Clear%2A> methods.
To add new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> objects to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.Add%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.AddRange%2A> methods.
## Examples The following code example removes the first <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> of the derived class <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> if the count of the collection is greater than zero. The example requires that you have created a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel>, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button>, and at least one other control on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>. The other controls are added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> control, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Panel> control added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>. When the button is clicked, the first control contained in the panel is removed from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection>.
[!code-cpp[ControlCollection#5](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/CPP/controlcollection.cpp#5)] [!code-csharp[ControlCollection#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/CS/controlcollection.cs#5)] [!code-vb[ControlCollection#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ControlCollection/VB/controlcollection.vb#5)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Name%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection>.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetChildIndex (System.Windows.Forms.Control child, int newIndex);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetChildIndex(class System.Windows.Forms.Control child, int32 newIndex) cil managed

Docs.param: The child to search for.
The new index value of the control.
Docs.summary: Sets the index of the specified child control in the collection to the specified index value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection.SetChildIndex%2A> is called, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> referred to by the `child` parameter is moved to the position specified by `newIndex` and the other <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> references in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection> are reordered to accommodate the move. The control with an index value of zero is at the top of the z-order, and higher numbers are closer to the bottom.

Docs.exception: The control is not in the .
